title: About
text: Most of my career has been in immunology and oncology, and my primary research interest centers on refining CAR-T constructs and gene editing enhancements, driving their optimal

title: LuisR
text:
Luis Rodriguez
Based in New York City I am a scientist with a background in cancer and immunology research. I have extensive experience spanning Academia and Industry, including Mnemo Therapeutics, Kite Pharma, Regeneron Pharmaceuticals, Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, and Genentech. My focus across these roles ranges from evaluating CAR-T constructs to conducting in vivo animal studies. I have expertise in a wide array of techniques, from multi-color flow cytometry to genetic manipulation, demonstrating a commitment to advancing our understanding of immunology and cancer biology.
Reach out and say hi!

title: Luis Rodriguez
text:
I am currently the Scientific Coordinator at the Research Network Data Science at the University of Vienna. Starting in January of 2024, I will be the Professor of Data Science for the Common Good at the Hertie School.
I previously worked on the Adaptive Experimentation team at Facebook Core Data Science in New York.
My research focuses on the intersection of machine learning and causal inference. I work a lot on experimental design and I think hard about how experimentation can be better and more efficient. I’m also interested in better applying the machinery of machine learning to observational causal inference.
I’m most interested in methodological research useful for the study of social phenomena.
